page.title: 17Sandringham Flower Show
page.content:
The Flower Show takes place annually at the end of July. It is always visited by H.M. The Queen Mother and often other members of The Royal Family.
In the main, the horticultural cups and trophies are competed for by the people of the Estate villages, but there are a number of open classes, which attract entries from the surrounding area.
The Park is alive with stalls selling all manner of goods from furniture to dolls' houses and there are side-shows and entertainments for all.
All day long the millitary band plays from the band-stand, while Morris Dancers can often be seen dancing in front of the beer-tent.
